Text: FWSorry to be talking business but nonetheless find attacted a copy of the Master customer list developed in the East I would like each of you to forward your working customer list to Lindsay Lindsay will then begin to build a list like that attached for the Central group This will be a work in Progress so dont worry about everything being perfect thanks Frank Original Message From Bates Kimberly Sent Thursday November PM To Vickers Frank Subject Kimberly Bates East GasOrigination Fax

Client Lista follow up to yesterdays Staff meeting I would like to implement the following strategy on getting our lists in working order Each of the working groups should appoint a lead for that group that will be ultimately responsible for the list activity Origination and midmarket should work together to prepare combined list Producer origination and producer midmarket should work together to prepare combined list By next Monday Feb I would like to have the combined market list and combined producer list identifying target customers and ENA responsibility By Monday Feb I would like to include Credit EOL Registered EOL participation level and existing business Select someone in the group to work with credit and EOL on these issues The final list needs to be in the same format and available electronically Kim Brown will assist in this effort Over time each group may expand their working list as needed I appreciate your attention to this matter Frank

Re Iroquois Gas Transmissions Eastchester Expansioncan you give me an education on this Frank John Hodge AM To Ruth CT Frank W nron Gil NRON Phil NRON David NRON Robin CT Dick CT Brad CT Sean NRON Julie A CT cc Subject Iroquois Gas Transmissions Eastchester Expansion Iroquois has shuffled their customer base for the expansion into New York City beginning in November The following customers have executed binding Precedent Agreements for year contracts that would require a buyout if the shipper tried to exit Volume Con Ed Dthd Keyspan Ravenswood Mirant Corporation Orion Power Virginia Power Energy Marketing Total Dthd Iroquois has changed their interconnect with Con Ed to the Throgs Neck section of the Bronx along the East River They are also starting to plan an expansion of the Eastchester project that will increase deliveries by to Dthd beginning in the time frame This expansion is timed similar to the recently announced plans by DukeKeyspan and El Paso for projects into Long Island Iroquois is targeting NYPA NRG and other announced merchant plants

Staff meetingmorning I received a call from the Chairs office requesting an electronic copy of our customer lists and coverage assignments Good thing that we have been working on that this week In addition they want to meet with Scott and me this week on Budget issues To that end it is important that we are ready to address several things at todays staff meeting Completed electronic customer lists and coverage assignments Because of the potential overlap with Freds group it is important that the Producer list be complete If the Producer does not show on our list it will by default be covered by Freds activity From each group Detailed write ups on a Key market strategies b Key Products c Regulatory strategy How are you going to make your budget See you are Frank
One more thingaddition bring your write ups for the notsohotlist so that Kim can prepare Kim be ready to discuss status of getting everyone on the O drive Thanks Frank

Deal Flowwill be reviewing the Budget with Louise and Dave on Thursday Louise has already hit me up about deal flow I need by noon tomorrow all of the Notsohotlist deals populated The form includes a Value Estimate categorie Make sure that you complete this section If it is accrual then put accrual Under Comments first insert the date and then provide you comments BE very descriptive on Description and comments Need very specific detail in these sections If you add a new deal add a row at the bottom of your current list so that all of your activity is grouped together Within the Originator Name area put your name as well as you business unit Producer Origination Midmarket etc Thank you for your attention to this Frank
Staff Meetingare out for spring break We will get back to Monday staff meetings next week Frank

Client Lista follow up to yesterdays Staff meeting I would like to implement the following strategy on getting our lists in working order Each of the working groups should appoint a lead for that group that will be ultimately responsible for the list activity Origination and midmarket should work together to prepare combined list Producer origination and producer midmarket should work together to prepare combined list By next Monday Feb I would like to have the combined market list and combined producer list identifying target customers and ENA responsibility By Monday Feb I would like to include Credit EOL Registered EOL participation level and existing business Select someone in the group to work with credit and EOL on these issues The final list needs to be in the same format and available electronically Kim Brown will assist in this effort Over time each group may expand their working list as needed I appreciate your attention to this matter Frank

Staff meetingmorning I received a call from the Chairs office requesting an electronic copy of our customer lists and coverage assignments Good thing that we have been working on that this week In addition they want to meet with Scott and me this week on Budget issues To that end it is important that we are ready to address several things at todays staff meeting Completed electronic customer lists and coverage assignments Because of the potential overlap with Freds group it is important that the Producer list be complete If the Producer does not show on our list it will by default be covered by Freds activity From each group Detailed write ups on a Key market strategies b Key Products c Regulatory strategy How are you going to make your budget See you are Frank
One more thingaddition bring your write ups for the notsohotlist so that Kim can prepare Kim be ready to discuss status of getting everyone on the O drive Thanks Frank

Deal Flowwill be reviewing the Budget with Louise and Dave on Thursday Louise has already hit me up about deal flow I need by noon tomorrow all of the Notsohotlist deals populated The form includes a Value Estimate categorie Make sure that you complete this section If it is accrual then put accrual Under Comments first insert the date and then provide you comments BE very descriptive on Description and comments Need very specific detail in these sections If you add a new deal add a row at the bottom of your current list so that all of your activity is grouped together Within the Originator Name area put your name as well as you business unit Producer Origination Midmarket etc Thank you for your attention to this Frank
Staff Meetingare out for spring break We will get back to Monday staff meetings next week Frank
VNGSequent has provided notice to terminate the Asset deal on Oct The deal would have automatically extended to Oct had notice not been provided FYI Frank

RE Florida Power Light Company Cc Does todays notice from FPL need to be referenced I think that someone from the Estate needs to execute this letter Probably Ed Frank Original Message From Hodge Jeffrey T Sent Wednesday December AM To Vickers Frank Cc Kaiser Jared Subject Florida Power Light Company Frank Here is a draft letter to be sent to FPL Let me know what you think Jeff File Florida Powerdoc
Customer letterJeff find attached a st draft of a generic customer letter I need to get someting out to New Jersey NAtural on Monday Frank

RE Asset Management and Supply Agreements Virginia Natural Gas Cc Dana thank you for the offer I will review your proposal and respond quickly As you implied in your offer it is important that we complete this transaction very quickly if we are going to do it My initial thoughts are that we would need to receive the payments over a maximum of months not months In addition as we are using the assets to manage an unrelated delivery obligation I will need to either determine another way to manage that delivery without the VNG assets or transfer the short position to you I do believe that given the details of this delivery obligation you will see it as a positive value to you I will provide an official response asap I suggest that we consider a time on Wed or Thur of this week to get together for discussion Frank Original Message From Dana Grams mailto Sent Tuesday November PM To Vickers Frank Subject Asset Management and Supply Agreements Virginia Natural Gas Frank Attached is a nonbinding offer from Sequent to Enron for the early release of the subject contracts Please review the attachment and contact me at your convenience My cell phone for this weekend is Happy Thanksgiving Dana Grams Sequent Energy

VNG updateAs you are aware I forwarded and offer to VNG that included transactions whereby ENA would sell quantites to Sequent In addition I requested that Sequent provide ENA with an offer to serve the Hopwell transaction did not tell VNG that it was Hopewell just described the general service Dana Grams told me last week that they were concerned about entering into an agreement to get back their assets because they felt we may file bancruptcy at which point they would get the assets back for free This is a lame excuse and I generally told him so I told him that we were not going to give back the assets and if he wanted them back we needed to get the same or better value to terminate our deal early He said they would revisit the arrangement and let me know I will keep you posted Frank

FW VNG againSee my email to Dana and his reply I will keep you posted Frank Original Message From Dana Grams mailto Sent Monday November PM To Vickers Frank Subject Re VNG Frank Sequent is extremely interested in an early termination of the EnronAGLES contract covering the asset management of the VNG We are in the process of evaluating a proposal to Enron and hope to have something to you shortly I will keep in touch Thanks Dana Grams Sequent Energy Vickers Frank PM Dana I wanted to follow up on our conversation of last week relative to my proposal emailed to you on We are in the process of considering several term transactions that could be supported by the VNG assets Given your previous interest in terminating the Gas Supply Assignment and Agency Agreement early I wanted to ask if you still have that interest If we complete any of the transactions being considered it will become more difficult to cleanly terminate the Agreement and return the assets to you without you taking on the obligations within such agreement It sounded to me last week as if you were no longer focused on the early termination for the reasons that you outlined We understood your request to look at this opportunity and we responded with our proposal Can you tell me if your interest has changed I want to remain focused on this if you are interest if things have changed I want to move on in another direction Frank This email is the property of Enron Corp andor its relevant affiliate and may contain confidential and privileged material for the sole use of the intended recipient s Any review use distribution or disclosure by others is strictly prohibited If you are not the intended recipient or authorized to receive for the recipient please contact the sender or reply to Enron Corp at and delete all copies of the message This email and any attachments hereto are not intended to be an offer or an acceptance and do not create or evidence a binding and enforceable contract between Enron Corp or any of its affiliates and the intended recipient or any other party and may not be relied on by anyone as the basis of a contract by estoppel or otherwise Thank you

Re ReviewTuesday at Frank John Hodge PM To Frank W nron cc Subject Re Review I still need to get with you I will be out Monday afternoon but could meet any other afternoon next week The job change has been invigorating and very enjoyable I really appreciate this opportunity Let me know when you are available Frank W Vickers AM To John NRON cc Subject Review John thanks for your review I have completed the form and at you convenience we can get together and put it to bed Let me know when Thanks Frank Embedded StdOleLink

TBG VNGpst Louise I know that you are dealing with more important things now but I wanted to keep you up to speed on TBG and VNG as I continue to move them forward Have completed negotiations on TBG Plan to forward execution documents on Monday Upon TBGs execution I will determine if we want to move forward delay or terminate the opportunity I will get with you on this I have negotiated a million payment from Sequent to terminate the Asset transaction year early Traders believe this is strong value and are willing to transact at that value Waiting on formalwritten offer from Sequent to complete evaluation Will keep you posted on these opportunities I hope that you are doing alright given the circumstances Frank

VNG Annual Pmt Cc Louise as you may be aware our VNG agreement provides for an annual payment of Shared Value to Sequent Energy on November This years payment is scheduled to be made on November in the amount of Given previous discussions I felt that it was appropriate to give you a heads up on this matter Frank

ENA EES Accountspst Louise find attached a memo which has been approved by all appropriate ENA representatives I would like to forward this to EES to confirm everyones understanding of what the parties have agreed to Are you in agreement with this approach Frank

TBGpst Louise I ran into John and he asked for a recap on TBG He has some history with this account and was aware of my direction Bottom line he asked that I come by tomorrow to discuss I am fine with your instructions to put this on hold I will not move to get with John until you approve Frank

TBGpst Louise need to ask a question for clarification TBG is ready to sign The settlement is structured to change the transaction beginning Nov If we delay they may revert in Nov to operating and scheduling volumes according to the existing agreement and not the settlement agreement which is bad for ENA A bit of a balancing act but I think that I have it under control My question is this Can I move forward with the execution of the Settlement IF the payment is not required until Nov I am sorry and I may be splitting hairs but dont want this to slip away If I need to hold off on everything I will do what is needed Frank

VNG Asset Dealpst Louise I just received a request from Sequent Energy marketing arm for Atlanta Gas that owns VNG requesting that we provide them with representations warranties and assurances of performance as it relates to our VNG asset deal Jeff Hodge and I are formulating a response I do not anticipate a problem A copy was accidentally forwarded to Mark Haedicke Mark has been contacted and asked to forward his copy to me Frank

RE TBGpst I understand The money out the door is approximately mm however we have dollars in excess of that amount reserved The mm will be paid out of that reserve and will not be new dollars I will keep you posted Thank you Frank Original Message From Kitchen Louise Sent Monday October PM To Vickers Frank Subject RE TBG go slow on this in terms of closing ref money out the door Original Message From Vickers Frank Sent Monday October PM To Kitchen Louise Subject TBG Louise I am moving forward on the TBG settlement I see that our meeting scheduled for tomorrow has been cancelled No problem I will find you if this appears to be ready to close to give you an update Structure remains as we had discussed Frank

TBGpst Louise I am moving forward on the TBG settlement I see that our meeting scheduled for tomorrow has been cancelled No problem I will find you if this appears to be ready to close to give you an update Structure remains as we had discussed Frank

TBGpst The settlement with TBG has been completed We will be making a payment to TBG of million on December New Agreement Same term Sept Terminate oud documents and replace with Master EnFolio Sell MMbtu per day baseload No swing quantites and purchase is no longer tied to power production at TBG plant Enron has multiple delivery points and price protection for specific delivery location million payment is less then possible amount due to TBG at end of year under current contract terms under true up provision Frank
Announcementpst Louise find attached a draft copy of the announcement for your reviewrevision When do you plan to make this announcement Frank

Yankee Gas Cc David Jones in East Gas Origination completed a transportation management transaction with Yankee Gas last night This negotiation has been ongoing but the values and the structure have until yesterday been extremely volatile David was able to bring the client to the table yesterday and complete the deal It is only a Nov Mar term but should book orig of This was not on the hotlist due to the uncertainty that had been surrounding its completion Yankee has worked this transaction with Engage for the past several years it is good to get one of these coming our way FYI Frank Yankee Gas is Conneticuts largest LDC and serves customers in states

RE How ya doing pst Happy to get together on Monday to give you all detail Yes you are right there is no such thing as Schedule C or deferred account it is cash The mm cash in Schedule C is due back to TBG in January anyway even if we do not restructure the deal to our favor The additional k is cash contributed by Office of the Chair John L in December of to Settle December and Jan with TBG When John gave his approval to complete this Settlement He asked that I attempt to defer lump sum payment to December I moved that out to December I will get on you calendar on Monday Frank Original Message From Kitchen Louise Sent Friday November PM To Vickers Frank Subject RE How ya doing Are we paying out mm over months or immediately There is no such thing as Schedule C or deferred account this is cash Lets discuss Monday Original Message From Vickers Frank Sent Friday November PM To Kitchen Louise Subject How ya doing Louise difficult week for all of us I hope that you are doing alright given the circumstances I expect to have the fully executed documents back from TBG on Monday We will be paying them approx million to settle Jan through Oct and convert the agreement to a baseload transaction beginning Nov In addition it eliminates a mm liability Payment will be made from combination of Schedule C and deferred account Will then book between k and mm As you are aware John reviewed this situation several weeks ago and gave the goahead I will contact you Monday prior to execution Frank

How ya doing pst Louise difficult week for all of us I hope that you are doing alright given the circumstances I expect to have the fully executed documents back from TBG on Monday We will be paying them approx million to settle Jan through Oct and convert the agreement to a baseload transaction beginning Nov In addition it eliminates a mm liability Payment will be made from combination of Schedule C and deferred account Will then book between k and mm As you are aware John reviewed this situation several weeks ago and gave the goahead I will contact you Monday prior to execution Frank

Mid Year East Origination Cc Louise please find attached the info requested The total Origination shown is greater then the value that you had provided The attached values were taken off of the itemized report that you had previously forwarded Frank

RE Plan B Cc In addition I think that Jennifer Shipos originally slated for Tx marketing will be better suited to return to the Derivatives group That being the case Tom Barry Brian and I agree that we should extend an offer to Morris Larubbio If Gary and Morris accept that will complete the marketing slots for Texas Frank Original Message From Milnthorp Rob Sent Wednesday January PM To Kitchen Louise Cc Calger Christopher F Martin Thomas A Tycholiz Barry Vickers Frank Subject Plan B Louise with mark smith out Id like approval to go to plan B which would be to extend an offer to Gary Brian How do we go about doing this This move is supported by Tom Martin Vickers and Tycholiz By cc to Chis any objections

Structuring Cc Earlier today Mark Breese resigned to accept another position Mark had been slated to go to NetCo in Structuring to work for Berney Aucoin Several weeks ago Eric Moon also resigned He too was slated for NetCo Structuring At this point Berney is the only remaining individual in NetCo Structuring I suggest that we identify individuals that might be considered for replacements These individuals are likely to currently be in EstateCo As EstateCo has not yet announced any retention program I am concerned that possible replacements may elect to leave EstateCo before we have a chance to discuss NetCo positions I would like to work with Berney and the Origination team to identify appropriate replacements and move to notify them of this opportunity Frank
Re NETCOLouise I am out on Jan and returning on the rd I have received your messages and will respond accordingly See you on the rd Frank Sent from my BlackBerry Wireless Hafrank vickers

TBGThe settlement with TBG has been completed We will be making a payment to TBG of million on December New Agreement Same term Sept Terminate oud documents and replace with Master EnFolio Sell MMbtu per day baseload No swing quantites and purchase is no longer tied to power production at TBG plant Enron has multiple delivery points and price protection for specific delivery location million payment is less then possible amount due to TBG at end of year under current contract terms under true up provision Frank

FW Firm Gas General Terms and ConditionsPST I am sure that I have accidentally left off someone that should receive a copy of this if so please forward it Legal will be providing a Contract class at some point to discuss these documents as well as Masters GISBs etc Please review this material and provide me with any material comments that you may have I will aggregate any comments and coordinate with legal Frank Original Message From Cook Mary Sent Wednesday January PM To Taylor Mark E Legal St Clair Carol Nemec Gerald Sager Elizabeth Hodge Jeffrey T Davis Angela Cc Haedicke Mark E Gonzalez Esmeralda Bradford William S Vickers Frank Calger Christopher F Kitchen Louise Subject Firm Gas General Terms and Conditions Attached are clean and redline versions of the current draft of firm gas general terms and conditions to be traded online and over the counter and with or without collateral Interruptible gas general terms and conditions will follow today Esmeralda please set up the above group including cc addresses as a contact group UBS Gas Forms Cordially Mary Cook Enron North America Corp Smith th Floor Legal Houston Texas fax

RE Plan B Cc PST In addition I think that Jennifer Shipos originally slated for Tx marketing will be better suited to return to the Derivatives group That being the case Tom Barry Brian and I agree that we should extend an offer to Morris Larubbio If Gary and Morris accept that will complete the marketing slots for Texas Frank Original Message From Milnthorp Rob Sent Wednesday January PM To Kitchen Louise Cc Calger Christopher F Martin Thomas A Tycholiz Barry Vickers Frank Subject Plan B Louise with mark smith out Id like approval to go to plan B which would be to extend an offer to Gary Brian How do we go about doing this This move is supported by Tom Martin Vickers and Tycholiz By cc to Chis any objections

FW Draft Gas Firm EOL GTC No CreditPST Original Message From Cook Mary Sent Thursday January PM To Hodge Jeffrey T Van Hooser Steve Vickers Frank Bradford William S St Clair Carol Subject Draft Gas Firm EOL GTC No Credit Importance High See attached for your review and comment to me by end of day or sooner if possible Soon to follow firm eol with credit And the same two firms for over the counter not eol Cordially Mary Cook Enron North America Corp Smith th Floor Legal Houston Texas fax
Gas Marketing Legal Team MeetingPST When Wednesday February AM AM GMT Central Time US Canada Where ECS

FW UBSWenergy Launch Meeting CORRECTIONPST for the meeting Frank Original Message From Mcquade Jennifer Sent Friday February PM To Abramo Caroline Belden Tim Benson Robert Calger Christopher F Choi Paul Clark Chad Cowan Mike Curry Mike Davis Mark Dana Dorland Chris Furrow Dale Gilbert George N Lagrasta Fred Llodra John Mcdonald Michael Otto Charles H Presto Kevin M Rorschach Reagan Rosman Stewart SMITH Douglas Thomas Paul Tycholiz Barry Valderrama Larry Vickers Frank Whalley Greg Zufferli John Subject FW UBSWenergy Launch Meeting CORRECTION Please disregard the list on the first email and use this one instead Also please note that for dialin purposes the phone number in the conference room is Original Message From Mcquade Jennifer Sent Friday February PM To Abramo Caroline Belden Tim Benson Robert Calger Christopher F Choi Paul Clark Chad Cowan Mike Curry Mike Davis Mark Dana Dorland Chris Furrow Dale Gilbert George N Lagrasta Fred Llodra John Mcdonald Michael Otto Charles H Presto Kevin M Rorschach Reagan Rosman Stewart SMITH Douglas Thomas Paul Tycholiz Barry Valderrama Larry Vickers Frank Whalley Greg Zufferli John Cc Forster David Diamond Daniel Mandola Teresa Subject UBSWenergy Launch Meeting Please plan on attending a meeting Monday February at AM in ECS in to pick up your launch packets and discuss the procedure and timeline for contacting customers Those of you outside of Houston should receive an overnight package Monday The meeting will be very brief If you have further questions or are unable to dialin you can contact me directly at or Teresa Mandola at Also please find attached the marketing contact list You can filter by your name in the PA column to view the counterparties which you are responsible for contacting regarding the Password Application

FW Firm Gas General Terms and ConditionsPST I am sure that I have accidentally left off someone that should receive a copy of this if so please forward it Legal will be providing a Contract class at some point to discuss these documents as well as Masters GISBs etc Please review this material and provide me with any material comments that you may have I will aggregate any comments and coordinate with legal Frank Original Message From Cook Mary Sent Wednesday January PM To Taylor Mark E Legal St Clair Carol Nemec Gerald Sager Elizabeth Hodge Jeffrey T Davis Angela Cc Haedicke Mark E Gonzalez Esmeralda Bradford William S Vickers Frank Calger Christopher F Kitchen Louise Subject Firm Gas General Terms and Conditions Attached are clean and redline versions of the current draft of firm gas general terms and conditions to be traded online and over the counter and with or without collateral Interruptible gas general terms and conditions will follow today Esmeralda please set up the above group including cc addresses as a contact group UBS Gas Forms Cordially Mary Cook Enron North America Corp Smith th Floor Legal Houston Texas fax

General ItemI would like to sue Kim in an expanded role within the group She will still be responsible for all of her current activities but will also work with the group on Pipeline postings and expansions RFP and information responses Development of Presentations etc I think that in the long run she can develop and be moved into other positions Especially after she earns her degree I have spoken with HR We will monitor to assure that she does not let any of her curent responsibilities slide Let me know if you have and concerns Also I have completed the Performance plan for John Hodge Required due to his ranking in I will leave a copy on your desk for review and execution Let me know if you have any questions Frank

TammiTammi told me that she has chosen not to sign the Employment Contract I understand her issues Even before she informed me of her decision I was thinking that we should support her for midyear promotion to Director I would like to get your thoughts on this Frank

Cc PST Lucy Scott Neal and I we run the East Gas business together are likely to need a new assistant when and if this deal goes forward I have not checked with anyone and I dont want to mislead you but would like to know IF you would be interested if things move forward Frank

FW Top CustomersPST Many of you received the attachment below directly from Dave Forster In order to prepare for NewCo coming back online we are going to use this list as the starting point to identify the primary launch customers To that end please review this list and confirm that ALL of your primary counterparties are listed After Christmas we will meet to reform the list by region and assign individual responsibilities The single objective of this effort is to confirm that we have every client identified as we move forward and further develop our launch strategy Thanks and Merry Christmas Frank Original Message From Calger Christopher F Sent Friday December AM To Vickers Frank Cc Milnthorp Rob Subject FW Top Customers Frank Attached is the file from Forster As we discussed it would be great if you could take the US Gas list and get regions and names next to each counterparty Probably best to show it to Luce Tycholiz Lagrasta Redmond and then the relevant traders Arnold Hunter Allen Neal First couple of days in the new year we will want to convene to plan with credit legal and Louise Regards Chris Calger Original Message From Forster David Sent Thursday December AM To Redmond Brian Luce Laura Lagrasta Fred Vickers Frank Tycholiz Barry Calger Christopher F Subject Top Customers Attached please find a spreadsheet showing customers with Global Counterparty ID useful for subsequent info requests Credit Headroom limit specific to the date the report was run Master Contract Name and Type Enron Entity on the contract Master Contract Number Rank by total value transacted in each of CDN Gas CDN Power US Gas US Power CDN Financial US Financial Actual Notional value transacted during Q This will hopefully provide a good guide to assist in Master contract negotiations Dave

RE Scott Neal East desk meetingPST Scott that is a great idea Alot to discuss as we prepare to get started I am a member of the UBS Restart subcommittee It meets every Tuesday at I would really benefit from attending your meeting but I have a time conflict Would you consider changing the time Before am or after noon if possible Frank Original Message From Neal Scott Sent Friday February PM To Vickers Frank Kaiser Jared Taylor Craig Subject FW Scott Neal East desk meeting frank jared craig fyi open discussion meeting with everybody including logistics to talk about the business Tuesday am Room Ill let you know Scott Original Message From Superty Robert Sent Friday February PM To Neal Scott Subject FW Scott Neal East desk meeting Original Message From Superty Robert Sent Friday February AM To Lamadrid Victor Cc Neal Scott Subject Scott Neal East desk meeting Victor as mentioned Scott wants to have a one hour meeting on Tuesday Ill get the room setup to talk about how he sees the desk operating in this new world Here is what he wants to cover List of trader responsibilities by pipe and point Scott will do this List of Logistics responsibilities by pipe we do this How will the business be different only pool transactions open discussion Talk about IT and short term Park and Loans and how that will be managed open discussion Emphasis on data collection and pipeline and market intelligienceOFOs capacity constraints LDC and other info open discussion In addition Scott really wants to set expectations and some ground rules Can you get the guys focused on this have them review and pull the necessary info Also probably makes sense to spend a few minutes on deal entry so we all hear from the start who is expected to do what That might be something Clarissa can pull together Tks Bob
VNGSequent has provided notice to terminate the Asset deal on Oct The deal would have automatically extended to Oct had notice not been provided FYI Frank

RE TBGThanks your humble servant Frank Original Message From Neal Scott SentMonday November PM ToVickers Frank SubjectRE TBG good job Frank Original Message From Vickers Frank SentMonday November PM ToRing Andrea CcNeal Scott Barbe Robin SubjectTBG Andy I have completed negotiation with TBG on the Settlement TBG has exe cuted the documents and Louise and John have approved the deal In short I want to make sure that you understand the effect on you Attached is a m ore detailed summary but generally I removed all swing flexibility from the deal They have baseload obligations of MMBtu per day We can del iver at any of the delivery points identified in the Agreement I will giv e you a copy of the Agreements however the primary delivery point is Stati on That is the location for all price settlements If we delivery at an alternate location we receive additional basis differentials for moving downstream Station and we pay the basis differential for moving ups tream Sta TBG has the right to move our deliveries back to Sta at anytime if we are delivering at alternate locations I want to check with you one more time before I execute the final documents I think that this is a great trade for ENA if I do say so myself My next effort is to clear up any issues with Trigen Frank File TBG Settlement Termsdoc

TBG Cc Andy I have completed negotiation with TBG on the Settlement TBG has exe cuted the documents and Louise and John have approved the deal In short I want to make sure that you understand the effect on you Attached is a m ore detailed summary but generally I removed all swing flexibility from the deal They have baseload obligations of MMBtu per day We can del iver at any of the delivery points identified in the Agreement I will giv e you a copy of the Agreements however the primary delivery point is Stati on That is the location for all price settlements If we delivery at an alternate location we receive additional basis differentials for moving downstream Station and we pay the basis differential for moving ups tream Sta TBG has the right to move our deliveries back to Sta at anytime if we are delivering at alternate locations I want to check with you one more time before I execute the final documents I think that this is a great trade for ENA if I do say so myself My next effort is to clear up any issues with Trigen Frank

RE natural gas inquiryI will take care of this Will give to David Jones or Robin Barbe to follow up on Thanks Frank Original Message From Neal Scott Sent Wednesday November PM To Vickers Frank Subject FW natural gas inquiry frank which originator should this go to Original Message From Arnold John Sent Wednesday November AM To Neal Scott Subject FW natural gas inquiry frank which originator should this go to Original Message From Hochschild Lenny Sent Monday November AM To Arnold John Subject FW natural gas inquiry Hey John Youre the only guy I know in Nat Gas Please forward this to the right person Thanks Lenny Original Message From Brown Ron X Sent Tuesday November AM To Hochschild Lenny Subject natural gas inquiry Hi Lenny Dont know if you are involved in this area or not I think maybe Anyway we have a refined lead contract with Hammond The local buyer for Pottstown PA is interested in getting information about natural gas for possible future use from ENRON If you could contact him or direct him to the person that is in a position to help it would be appreciated His name is Joe Stewartz EMAIL address is telephone number Fax number Thanking you in advance and hope all is well with you Regards Ron Brown

FW TrigenNassau Cc Andy looks like your deliveries at Z are settled to you at Z and Z That would imply that you have the right to deliver at Z and Z to match the pricing I quess we need to confirm that and determine the correct s at each Zone Kam and Maureen will follow up on this Frank Original Message From Keiser Kam Sent Thursday November AM To Vickers Frank Subject TrigenNassau Frank Regarding TrigenNassau Andy sells them the gas at TranscoZ but is priced half at Zone half at Zone This is how the deal was originally booked in TAGG and therefore the desk price must match I would also like to let you know that I will be moving to the West desk effective tomorrow Phillip Love is moving from the Central desk to take my place and Scott Palmer is moving over to the Central desk Obviously me and Scott will be helping Phillip with VNG Please let me know if you have any concerns or questions Thanks Kam x

TBG Cc Andy I have completed negotiation with TBG on the Settlement TBG has exe cuted the documents and Louise and John have approved the deal In short I want to make sure that you understand the effect on you Attached is a m ore detailed summary but generally I removed all swing flexibility from the deal They have baseload obligations of MMBtu per day We can del iver at any of the delivery points identified in the Agreement I will giv e you a copy of the Agreements however the primary delivery point is Stati on That is the location for all price settlements If we delivery at an alternate location we receive additional basis differentials for moving downstream Station and we pay the basis differential for moving ups tream Sta TBG has the right to move our deliveries back to Sta at anytime if we are delivering at alternate locations I want to check with you one more time before I execute the final documents I think that this is a great trade for ENA if I do say so myself My next effort is to clear up any issues with Trigen Frank

FW Firm Gas General Terms and ConditionsPST I am sure that I have accidentally left off someone that should receive a copy of this if so please forward it Legal will be providing a Contract class at some point to discuss these documents as well as Masters GISBs etc Please review this material and provide me with any material comments that you may have I will aggregate any comments and coordinate with legal Frank Original Message From Cook Mary Sent Wednesday January PM To Taylor Mark E Legal St Clair Carol Nemec Gerald Sager Elizabeth Hodge Jeffrey T Davis Angela Cc Haedicke Mark E Gonzalez Esmeralda Bradford William S Vickers Frank Calger Christopher F Kitchen Louise Subject Firm Gas General Terms and Conditions Attached are clean and redline versions of the current draft of firm gas general terms and conditions to be traded online and over the counter and with or without collateral Interruptible gas general terms and conditions will follow today Esmeralda please set up the above group including cc addresses as a contact group UBS Gas Forms Cordially Mary Cook Enron North America Corp Smith th Floor Legal Houston Texas fax

FW EES AgreementSorry here is attachement from earlier Email In addition I have attached an email that Dave F prepared Frank Original Message From Forster David Sent Monday October PM To Vickers Frank Subject FW EES Agreement Frank I didnt see an attachment on your email showing what you had written so far but following is an email I sent to the regional heads for East Power Origination Feel free to cut and paste as appropriate Dave Original Message From Forster David Sent Thursday October PM To Curry Mike Kroll Heather Tricoli Carl Subject EES Agreement Earlier this week EES Dave Delainey and Janet Dietrich agreed the following with ENA EES will continue to approach utilitiesmunis to sell their whitepaper concept but will restrict their efforts to only the following until such time as the concept is proven or abandoned City of San Antonio City of Austin Brownsville Public Utility Board City of Anaheim Peoples SMUD Silicon Valley Santa Clara City of Memphis EES agreed that they should not be approaching industrials which fall within the previously established ENA SIC codes and committed to reigning their people in It was agreed that EES would work with ENA to determine if there are subgroups within the SIC codes which are too small for ENA but which EES should be covering Chris Calger agreed to work with EES on determining this The SIC Code categories which ENA is responsible for are as follows note that while the categories have been agreed the actual code numbers are my own interpretation of the categories Primary Metals Mining and Extraction Oil and Gas Extraction Paper and Forest Products Chemicals except for pharmaceutical biotech and small specialty chemical that will be EES customers DOW Chemical Refining Petroleum and Coal Manufacturing Plastics and Rubber Manufacturing Fertilizer Rail Cement Large Agricultural Processing Dave

RE Cc Kim Jared can look into this opportunity Give him a call Thanks Frank Original Message From Ward Kim S Houston Sent Monday November PM To Vickers Frank Subject Frank I am working with Panda Resources to potentially supply gas to a couple of their Arizona facilities However they say they have a plant coming online March st in El dorado Ark They looking for TX Gas for Mar jun and Tn zone starting July She has gone over the structures that she is looking for Is there someone in your group that would be interested in working on this potential gas supply with them Let me know Thanks Kim

Project Boomerang Cc you may know we are conducting due diligence on california QFs that El Paso Merchant Energy purchased from Dynegy on Feb of this year we are considering the purchase of of El Pasos interest In discussions with Paul he suggested that I get you involved with the transaction Two things come to immediate attention I heard that the PUC has filed suit against El Paso relative to these assets What do you know about this NOw that the CPUC is trying to implement terms of AB s section alot of questions and methods are surfacing about calculations of payments to QFs Are you in a postion to follow this debate and keep me informed during the process Thanks Frank

Re Project Boomerangthanks for the response Consider yourself a member of Project Boomerang I suggest that we try to talk sometime Monday and I can fill in some of the detail on this effort I did hear that the lawsuit was filed under Section of AB Does that make any sense to you I will call you Monday morning to discuss the project and the role that you can play to help the effort Thanks Frank Jeff ES on PM To Frank W CT cc Paul CT Subject Re Project Boomerang Frank Sorry I didnt get back to you sooner Were finalizing a deal to among other things have Socalgas unbundle its instate transport storage and balancing sell off the transport and storage rights in an open season and create a secondary market for each They will also permit trading of imbalances on their system The deals getting finalized today Paul your pal Joe Karp has joined the deal The deal is currently scheduled to take effect beginning April Stephanie Millers been kept in the loop May be something that folks might want include in due diligence wrt to any gas contracts tied to the QFs Your questions I am aware that the PUC just filed suit at FERC against El Paso for selling about Bcfday of gas capacity into California to Merchant Energy but hadnt heard about a suit regarding the QFs I will find out and let you know Yes I am in a position to follow the debate and keep you informed Im assuming that your are up to speed on the debate as of today If not let me know and I andor Paul can fill you in If theres anything else dont hesitate to holler Good weekend to you both Best Jeff Frank W CT PM To Jeff ES cc Paul Kaufman Subject Project Boomerang Jeff as you may know we are conducting due diligence on california QFs that El Paso Merchant Energy purchased from Dynegy on Feb of this year we are considering the purchase of of El Pasos interest In discussions with Paul he suggested that I get you involved with the transaction Two things come to immediate attention I heard that the PUC has filed suit against El Paso relative to these assets What do you know about this NOw that the CPUC is trying to implement terms of AB s section alot of questions and methods are surfacing about calculations of payments to QFs Are you in a postion to follow this debate and keep me informed during the process Thanks Frank

Response Cc need to add some discussion focused on QF issues in California and how resolution to certain items would enhance QF ownership and provide the utilities with optimal performance of the QFs and perhaps encourage new capacity development at existing QF locations The utilities should be motivated to enter into buyout buydown blend and extend negotiate fixed energy prices and other restructuring transactions with the QFs The utilites have the ability to hedge the floating price currently being paid to the QFs They should be motivated to look into these structures Utilities should provide some clarification to the energy prices under QF PPAs There is alot of risks around SRAC and PX that affect both the utilities and the QF owners It seems like resolution to that risk is beneficial to both the utility as well as the QF QFs should have the ability to move excess capacity and energy into either the market andor to the utility That would create additional economic incentives for the QFs to run and perhaps increase their capacity Frank

Project Boomerang Cc you may know we are conducting due diligence on california QFs that El Paso Merchant Energy purchased from Dynegy on Feb of this year we are considering the purchase of of El Pasos interest In discussions with Paul he suggested that I get you involved with the transaction Two things come to immediate attention I heard that the PUC has filed suit against El Paso relative to these assets What do you know about this NOw that the CPUC is trying to implement terms of AB s section alot of questions and methods are surfacing about calculations of payments to QFs Are you in a postion to follow this debate and keep me informed during the process Thanks Frank

Response Cc need to add some discussion focused on QF issues in California and how resolution to certain items would enhance QF ownership and provide the utilities with optimal performance of the QFs and perhaps encourage new capacity development at existing QF locations The utilities should be motivated to enter into buyout buydown blend and extend negotiate fixed energy prices and other restructuring transactions with the QFs The utilites have the ability to hedge the floating price currently being paid to the QFs They should be motivated to look into these structures Utilities should provide some clarification to the energy prices under QF PPAs There is alot of risks around SRAC and PX that affect both the utilities and the QF owners It seems like resolution to that risk is beneficial to both the utility as well as the QF QFs should have the ability to move excess capacity and energy into either the market andor to the utility That would create additional economic incentives for the QFs to run and perhaps increase their capacity Frank
